gurmukhi: clw munI qij prhir Awsw ] mhw mon Ar mhw audwsw ] prm q`q byqw bfBwgI ] mhw mon hir ko AnurwgI ]205]
transliteration: Chalaa Mounndtaj(i) Par-har(i) Aasaa|| Mahaa Mon Ar Mahaa Udaasaa|| Param Tatt Betaa  Badbhaagee|| Mahaa Mon Hat(i) Ko Anuraagee||205||
translation: The sage forsaking all desires and observing great silence moved further in a state of apathy; he was a great knower of the Essence, a silence-observer and a lover of the Lord.205.

gurmukhi: prm purK pUro bfBwgI ] mhw munI hir ko rs pwgI ] bHm Bgiq Ktgun rs lInw ] eyk nwm ky rs sau BInw ]206]
transliteration: Param Purakh Pooro  Badbhaagee|| Mahaa Mounndhar(i) Ko Ras Paagee|| Brahm Bhagad(i) Khatgoun Ras Leenaa|| Ek Naam K Eras Sau Bheenaa||206||
translation: He was a great sage, absorbed in the love of he Supreme Purusha i.e. the Lord; he was a devotee of Brahman, the knower of he philosophies of the six Shastras and the one who remained absorbed in the Name of the Lord.206.

gurmukhi: au`jl gwq mhw mn sohY ] sur nr mun sB ko mn mohY ] jhN jhN jwie d`q SuB krmw ] qhN qhN hoq sBY inhkrmw ]207]
transliteration: Ujjal Gadt Mahaa Man Sohai|| Sur Nar Mounndsabh Ko Man Mohair|| Jahan Jahan Jaae Datt Shoubh Karmaa|| Tahan Tahan Hot Sabhai Nihkarmaa||207||
translation: The white body of the great sage was alluring the gods, men and sages; wherever Dutt, the sage performing good actions went, all those who resided there, achieved passivity.207.

gurmukhi: Brm moh iqh dyKq BwgY ] rwm Bgq sB hI auiT lwgY ] pwp qwp sB dUr prweI ] ins idn rhY eyk ilv lweI ]208]
transliteration: Bharam Moh Tih Dekhat Bhaagad|| Raam Bhagad Sabh Hiouth(i) Laagad|| Paap Taap Sabh Door Paraaee|| Nis Din Rahai Ek Liv Laaee||208||
translation: Seeing him, all the illusions, attachment etc, fled away and all were absorbed in the devotion of the Lord; the sins and ailments of all were destroyed, all remained engrossed in the meditation of one Lord.208.

gurmukhi: kwCn eyk qhw iml geI ] so AwcUk pukwrq BeI ] Bwv Xwih mn mwih inhwrw ] dsvo gurU qwih bIcwrw ]209]
transliteration: Kaadhhan Ek Tahaa Mil Gade|| So Aachook Poukaarat Bhaee|| Bhaav Yah(i) Man Maah(i) Nihaaraa|| Dasvo Guroo Taah(i) Beechaaraa||209||
translation: The sage met a lady-gardener there, who was shouting continuously; the sage feeling the notion of her shouts in his mind, adopted her the tenth Guru.209.

gurmukhi: jo sovY so mUlu gvwvY ] jo jwgY hir hiRdY bswvY ] s`iq boil Xw kI hm mwnI ] jog igAwn jwgY qy jwnI ]210]
transliteration: Jo Sovai So Moond(u) Gadaavai|| Jo Jaagad Har(i) Hridai Basaavai|| Satt(i) Bol(i) Uaa Kiham Maanee|| Jog Giaan Jaagad Te Jaanee||210||
translation: He, who will serve the Lord, he will destroy the ego, which is the origin of the world; who will actually be awakened from the sleep of maya, he will enshrine the Lord the sleep of maya, he will enshrine the Lord in hi heart; the sage accepted the voice o
End of the description of the adoption of the Lady-Gradener as the Tenth Guru.
Now begins the description of the adoption of Surath as the Eleventh Guru

gurmukhi: AwgY d`q dyv qb clw ] swDy srb jog kI klw ] Aimq qyj Aru aujl pRBwaU ] jwnuk bnw dUsr hir rwaU ]211]
transliteration: Aagad Datt Dev Tah Chalaa|| Saadhe Sarab Jog Kikalaa|| Amit Tej Ar(u) Ujal Prabhaaoo|| Jaanouk Banaa Doosar Har(i) Raaoo||211||
translation: Then the sage Dutt, practising all the arts of Yoga, moved forward; his glory was infinite and he seemed to be the second God.211.

gurmukhi: sB hI klw jog kI swDI ] mhwN is`D monI min lwDI ] AiDk qyj Aru AiDk pRBwvw ] jw liK ieMdRwsn Qhrwvw ]212]
transliteration: Sabh Hikalaa Jog Kisaadhee|| Mahaan Siddh Moniman(i) Laadhee|| Adhik Tej Ar(u) Adhik Prabhaavaa|| Jaa Lakh(i) Indraasan Thahraavaa||212||
translation: That great adept and the silence-observing purusha practiced all the skill of Yoga; seeing his extreme glory and impact, the seat of Indra also trembled.212.
